speaker: Agent
text: NovaNet technical support, Priya here. What’s going on with your connection today?

speaker: Customer
text: No internet since last night. There was heavy rain and now it’s dead.

speaker: Agent
text: Alright—we’ll figure out if this is an outage or equipment issue. First, account verification: name and service address?

speaker: Customer
text: Manoj Kulkarni, 17, Riverbend Colony, Thane.

speaker: Agent
text: Thanks Manoj. I’m checking your area status and your line diagnostics. While I do that, please look at the ONT box lights—Power, PON, LOS.

speaker: Customer
text: Power is green. PON is off. LOS is red blinking.

speaker: Agent
text: Okay, that’s very telling. LOS blinking red usually means ‘Loss of Signal’ on the fiber—often a cut, bend, water ingress, or upstream outage. Let me check for known outages in Thane.

speaker: Agent
text: I’m seeing an active outage ticket affecting your sector—storm-related fiber damage. That explains the LOS. Estimated restoration window is today between 4 PM and 8 PM.

speaker: Customer
text: So I just wait? I have meetings.

speaker: Agent
text: I get it. Waiting is not a plan, it’s a vibe. Here’s what I can do: (1) confirm your line is actually part of the outage (not a local break), (2) create a priority note if you’re work-from-home, and (3) discuss temporary backup options.

speaker: Customer
text: Do it.

speaker: Agent
text: I’m running an optical signal test remotely—this takes about 20 seconds.

speaker: Agent
text: Test result: no optical power detected at your ONT. That aligns with the outage. So it’s not just your device.

speaker: Customer
text: Okay.

speaker: Agent
text: Now, priority note: are you a business account or residential?

speaker: Customer
text: Residential.

speaker: Agent
text: Even for residential, we can tag it as ‘WFH critical’ but it doesn’t magically teleport technicians—just helps triage if they’re deciding between branches. I’ll add the note.

speaker: Customer
text: Fine.

speaker: Agent
text: Backup options: Do you have mobile hotspot data you can use temporarily? Or a secondary ISP? Some customers use a 4G dongle during outages.

speaker: Customer
text: I can hotspot but it’s slow and expensive.

speaker: Agent
text: Understood. Once service is restored, you can request an outage credit for downtime beyond our SLA threshold. For residential, we usually credit based on hours down. I can also pre-note your account so you don’t have to argue later.

speaker: Customer
text: Yes please.

speaker: Agent
text: Done. Now, just to be safe, let’s do a quick physical check: is the fiber patch cord from the wall to the ONT bent sharply or pinched? Storms sometimes shift furniture or the connector loosens.

speaker: Customer
text: It’s… kinda tight behind the table.

speaker: Agent
text: If you can, gently straighten it—no sharp bends. And ensure the green connector is firmly seated. Don’t yank—fiber is delicate.

speaker: Customer
text: Okay I adjusted it. LOS still blinking.

speaker: Agent
text: Then it’s definitely upstream. I’m creating an individual ticket linked to the outage so you get notifications: TS-991702. You’ll receive SMS updates, including when it’s resolved.

speaker: Customer
text: What if it’s not fixed by 8?

speaker: Agent
text: If it goes past the ETA, the outage ticket updates automatically. Worst-case, if it’s still down tomorrow morning, we can schedule a field technician to check the drop line to your building. But right now, dispatching to each home during an outage slows restoration.

speaker: Customer
text: Okay.

speaker: Agent
text: One more thing: Do you have a UPS powering the ONT? After storms, unstable power can cause weird light patterns, but your LOS blinking suggests signal loss, not power.

speaker: Customer
text: No UPS.

speaker: Agent
text: Got it. When the outage resolves, your PON should turn solid green and LOS should go off. If PON stays off after you get an ‘outage resolved’ message, call us—then it’s likely a local line issue.

speaker: Customer
text: Alright.

speaker: Agent
text: Recap: confirmed storm outage in your sector, LOS blinking red indicates fiber signal loss, ETA 4–8 PM today, ticket TS-991702 created with WFH note and outage credit note. Anything else I can do right now?

speaker: Customer
text: No.

speaker: Agent
text: Hang in there. Storms: free ambience, paid consequences. Thanks for calling NovaNet.
